meanings.definition: A type of plasmid that can carry large DNA inserts.
meanings.sent1: Scientists use cosmids to study genes in detail.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician inserted the cosmids into the bacterial cells.
meanings.sent3: The cosmids decided to throw a party inside the cell nucleus.
meanings.sent4: The cosmids were like tiny delivery trucks carrying genetic information.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the cosmids glowed brightly, revealing their contents.

meanings.definition: Plasmids that combine the features of plasmids and phages.
meanings.sent1: Researchers are investigating the potential of cosmids in genetic engineering.
meanings.sent2: The cosmids were designed to target specific genes in the DNA sequence.
meanings.sent3: The cosmids and phages had a friendly competition in the bacterial cell.
meanings.sent4: In the world of genetics, cosmids were the ultimate hybrid creatures.
meanings.sent5: The cosmids acted as genetic chameleons, adapting to different environments.
